entry.title: Colombian President-Elect's Economic Revamp Faces Cost Crunch
entry.content: Gustavo Petro proposed jobs for all and cuts to oil output, but many doubt he will have the funds or clout to implement sweeping change.

entry.title: Ukraine Orders Withdrawal From Severodonetsk to Avoid Encirclement
entry.content: The pullback ends a battle that lasted nearly two months and gives Russia a small but symbolically important victory in the grinding war for control of eastern Ukraineâ€™s Donbas area.

entry.title: Nuclear Power Is Poised for a Comeback. The Problem Is Building the Reactors.
entry.content: Western countries are making big bets on nuclear energy to help tackle climate change and reduce dependence on Russian oil and gas, but are short on experience in building the plants after shunning them for years.
